title: Classic Quilting Bees
description: From patchwork to applique, test your knowledge of the beloved American quilting tradition!

questions.question: What was a 'quilting bee'?
options: A social gathering where women worked together to complete a quilt

questions.question: What classic quilt pattern features interlocking rings or circles, symbolizing friendship and marriage?
What are the three layers that make up a traditional quilt?
What simple quilt block pattern, made from nine equal squares, was often a beginner's first project?
What quilt pattern features strips of fabric arranged around a center square, resembling a rustic dwelling?
What type of quilt was traditionally made for a young woman's hope chest before her wedding?
options: A bridal quilt or bride's quilt

questions.question: What is the term for the small, even stitches sewn through all three layers of a quilt to hold them together?
What type of Victorian-era quilt used random-shaped pieces of fancy fabrics like silk and velvet with decorative embroidery?
What large frame was used to stretch out the quilt layers so multiple quilters could work on it at the same time?
What quilting technique involves cutting fabric shapes and sewing them onto a background fabric to create a design?
What was a 'friendship quilt' or 'signature quilt'?
options: A quilt made entirely by one person for a friend
A quilt with a friendship theme pattern
A quilt sold at a charity auction
A quilt where each block was made by a different person, often signed

questions.question: What material was traditionally used as the warm filling between the quilt top and backing?
What strip of fabric finishes and covers the raw edges around the outside of a completed quilt?
Which Amish community became especially famous for their bold, geometric quilt designs using solid-colored fabrics?
What practical purpose did quilts originally serve in American pioneer homes?
options: Warmth and bedding, using up scraps of fabric
